âœ¨ noctalia-shell | QML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a customizable and minimal desktop environment for Wayland compositors.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Native support for Niri, Hyprland, Sway and MangoWC â€¢ Built on Quickshell for performance â€¢ Minimalist design philosophy â€¢ Easily customizable â€¢ Multiple color schemes
ðŸ“– Summary: Noctalia Shell is a minimal and customizable desktop shell for Wayland compositors. It's built on Quickshell and designed to be lightweight and easily adaptable to different user styles, with native support for compositors like Niri, Hyprland, Sway, and MangoWC.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ gdrive | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing Google Drive files and accounts from the command line, particularly useful for scripting and automation.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Account management (add, export, import) â€¢ File upload â€¢ Command-line interface for Google Drive interaction â€¢ Configuration stored in $HOME/.config/gdrive3/
ðŸ“– Summary: gdrive is a command-line application written in Rust for interacting with Google Drive. It allows users to manage their Google Drive files and accounts directly from the terminal. While it's a successor to gdrive2, it currently implements only basic functionality.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ termusic | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Playing music and podcasts from the terminal, with support for local files and downloads from online sources.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Terminal-based user interface â€¢ Support for various audio formats (MP4, MP3, OGG, FLAC, WAV, etc.) â€¢ Support for multiple backends (Rusty, MPV, Gstreamer) â€¢ Podcast support â€¢ Free music download from YouTube, NetEase, Migu and KuGou
ðŸ“– Summary: Termusic is a terminal-based music and podcast player written in Rust. It aims to provide a free and open-source alternative to online streaming services, allowing users to play locally stored audio files and download content from platforms like YouTube, NetEase, Migu, and KuGou.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ whitebox | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring the availability and performance of external VPN services using Prometheus.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-protocol VPN Probing (VMESS, VLESS, Trojan, Wireguard, Shadowsocks) â€¢ RESTful API Service for on-demand connectivity checks â€¢ Custom Probe Configuration (connection details, target URLs, timeouts) â€¢ Prometheus Metrics Integration
ðŸ“– Summary: The whitebox repository provides a Prometheus exporter for monitoring the availability of external VPN services. It supports various VPN protocols like VMESS, VLESS, Trojan, WireGuard, and Shadowsocks, exposing probe results as Prometheus metrics for comprehensive VPN tunnel health monitoring.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ free-proxy | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Obtaining working proxies for web scraping, bypassing geographical restrictions, or masking IP addresses in various applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Scrapes proxies from multiple websites (sslproxies.org, us-proxy.org, free-proxy-list.net) â€¢ Checks proxy validity â€¢ Filters proxies by country â€¢ Specifies acceptable timeout for proxy connections â€¢ Randomizes the list of proxies
ðŸ“– Summary: The `free-proxy` Python library scrapes free proxies from various websites, checks their validity, and allows filtering by country and timeout. It provides a simple way to obtain working proxies for use with requests, Selenium, or other applications, returning them as strings.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ anytype-ts | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Personal knowledge management and secure data storage across devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Offline-first, local storage with optional peer-to-peer sync â€¢ Zero-knowledge encryption â€¢ Composable blocks (text, databases, kanban, calendar & custom Types) â€¢ Cross-platform desktop client (Electron + TypeScript) â€¢ Extensible through gRPC API and AI Agents
ðŸ“– Summary: Anytype Desktop is a local-first, peer-to-peer, and end-to-end encrypted knowledge OS for macOS, Windows, and Linux. It allows users to gather, connect, and remix all kinds of information, create various content types, and define their own data model while ensuring data privacy and offline accessibility.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ chart_server_dart | Dart
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Dynamically generating and serving customizable bar chart images via an HTTP API.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Dynamic Bar Chart Generation â€¢ Fully Customizable Colors â€¢ Simple REST Interface â€¢ High Performance â€¢ Uses the `image` package for efficient image manipulation
ðŸ“– Summary: The chart_server_dart repository provides a simple, high-performance HTTP API for dynamically generating customizable bar chart images (PNG format). Built with Dart and the Shelf framework, it accepts data and color configurations via a JSON request body, offering a REST interface for easy integration.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
